page.title: 04Health Care in Southam
page.content: In 1985 Southam residents are well looked after health-wise. Babies are taken to a local clinic where they are regularly weighed and checked. Children are checked at school and see a school dentist as well. There is a dentist in the town and also a modern doctor's surgery. Anything serious is referred to the hospitals in Warwick and Leamington. Older people can be cared for at home or in a residential home. At home a nurse will visit an old or ill person. A home help will do the shopping and the housework and hot lunches can be delivered four days a week. There are two homes providing sheltered accomodation for elderly people in Southam. The residents have a comfortable flat each. A blood doning unit visits the town four times a year.
